Phrase: Led by Amiens and Rouen, so-called ruins exploration specialists, the Special Steel Squad set foot inside the Ruins of Steel.

As Yakutsk said earlier, it can be inferred that these ruins are military fortifications. The inner walls are made of iron, with iron towers extending above the ground. Clearly different from technology that is used in Verforet.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: The cylindrical tower extending upwards may be a concealed turret. I think it pops up from underground and attack enemies on the ground.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Unlike the tochka, it is hidden underground when not in use. Likely there is a mechanism to raise the turret.

Name: Queensway
Phrase: You both seem to know a lot about it.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: As an Eisengradian soldier, but of course. When it comes to military installations and weapons, you're in good hands.

Name: Yoshino
Phrase: Yoshino is also a Kougyoukei, so is knowledgeable about these stuff.

Name: Queensway
Phrase: Miss Yoshino's knowledge and skills are quite exceptional... The country of Nishiki's industrial sector overall is also very well-developed as a whole, and it is well known that the Eisengrad's Central Army's technical team is supported by Nishiki.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: But even the Central Army doesn't actually make that many things like the ones in this site.

Name: Yakutsk
Phrase: Concealed turrets are not that useful against Mist Monsters...

Name: Amiens
Phrase: Amazing, I didn't know there were ruins like this in Verforet...

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: There are all kinds of ruins in Verforet, but I've never seen anything quite like this. That stone fort's special enough, but it's even more mysterious inside.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: I came here because I thought I could help you all with ruins studies, but I'm not so sure anymore. Are these ruins really even ancient...?

Name: Rouen
Phrase: What's with your dejected tone about? This is no archaeological site no matter how you look at it. So I ask you, if this these aren't ancient ruins, then what is it?

Name: Amiens
Phrase: T-then, is a fortress built by the Eisengrad Army and the Verforet Gendarmerie?

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Even though it has appeared out of thin air and has become the source of Phantom Mist?

Name: Amiens
Phrase: Because there's steel everywhere, you see? Most ancient ruins are made of stone or wood. Such large-scale steel ruins can't be made with Verforet's current technology alone.

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Then I have a very difficult question for you, Amiens. Verforet, St. Iris, Nishiki, Eisengrad and Flamarine, do you know of any ancient relics made of steel that exist in all five countries?

Name: Amiens
Phrase: T-That'll be the steel railways... right?

Name: Rouen
Phrase: See, you know the answer. If there are indestructible railways that are impervious to magic or explosives, then it's not strange to encounter steel ruins that can be hidden underground.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: In-Indeed...

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Gosh, you really need me to be there for you after all. If you like ruins, you should have a broader perspective. Also, you should learn a bit more about history.

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Look, there's a cipher there, made up of ancient Verforench script and an unintelligible language. Let's decipher it and find out what these ruins are for. That's our job.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: W-Wait please!

Name: Putra
Phrase: How surprising, Rouen looks more reliable.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Umm, I can't say for sure if she's reliable, but Rouen is definitely the smarter one. She's more knowledgeable in a wide range of subjects, not just about archaeological sites.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Rouen has always been at the top of her class at school, you know? I heard she used to be a very serious top student. She was a nice young lady and she studied a lot. She used to stay inside the library on her days off.

Name: Putra
Phrase: Really? I don't mean to be rude, but she doesn't look like one at all!

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Amiens told me that, so it's probably true.

Name: Putra
Phrase: I didn't know, I originally thought she was just like me...

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Oui, I think Putra and Rouen are similar though?

Name: Putra
Phrase: Really? I'm not that serious and I can't study at all. When I think of a nice young lady and a top student, Queensway is the first person that comes to my mind...

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Hmmhmm... I could read that. So this ancient language section is written in three different languages from three different eras. And, the incomprehensible language seems to be written unintelligibly on purpose.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: All these ancient languages are from humans after all. It is easier to decipher than elven ancient language. Well, it took me quite a long time, but I am sure Rouen would decipher it fast.

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Of course. I mean, I'm already done.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: What? Already? Isn't that too soon at any rate? You've only just read the sentence patterns, haven't you?

Name: Rouen
Phrase: I've told you I got it right. This is not that long of a sentence. Most of what is written here is noise.

Name: Rouen
Phrase: The important part is this ancient language section written upside down. 'Schoe', and this one 'Nienborough'?

Name: Amiens
Phrase: Oh, shouldn't this be 'Nenbourg' instead?

Name: Rouen
Phrase: The third one is 'Ouvrage'. You stick these together first and read them. If you put them together, it's 'Ouvrage Schoenenbourg'. So this was a fortification after all.

Name: Amiens
Phrase: The rest is a series of numbers, right? Even I can easily recognize these. Let's see... 25, 44, 73, 94?

Name: Amiens
Phrase: This is a riddle. But it's difficult because it's mixed with languages I can't read...

Name: Rouen
Phrase: The unreadable languages are fake. Use 'Schoenenbourg' and these numbers should give you the answer. 25 to 94. 100 meaning 10? Because this sentence is 10 lines in total... 10?

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Shouldn't 25 be read as 2, 5 then? The fifth word in the second line is ancient. As well as the fourth word in the fourth line!

Name: Amiens
Phrase: So pull out the relevant words from that. The four ancient words together are...

Name: Rouen
Phrase: 'Gardien', 'Isolé', 'Trouvez', 'Éclair'...

Name: Amiens & Rouen
Phrase: 'Ouvrage Schoenenbourg. The Guardian is isolated. Find the lightning'!

Name: *BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP*
Phrase: What is this alarm!?

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Kuhuhuhuhu! I appears that I have succeeded in deciphering the code! The guardian of Ouvrage Schoenenbourg have shown us the way.

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Ouvrage Schoenenbourg?

Name: Amiens
Phrase: It is the name of these ruins. Once we deciphered the code, 'Ouvrage Schoenenbourg. The guardian is isolated. Find for lightning' came to mind, and when we read it aloud, the ruins reacted.

Name: Rouen
Phrase: The door to the Ruins of Steel has thus been opened! The guidance of the Holy Angel shalt illuminate the cold darkness!

Name: Putra
Phrase: Amazing. Those two are really professionals at exploring ruins, aren't they?

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Hmmhmm, they're pretty good at it, aren't they?

Name: Queensway
Phrase: I'm amazed that this mechanism works in response to their voices. Seems like this would allow us to go on even without lights. From the looks of it, this tunnel seems to go on for quite a while...?
Invalid User Code Recognized. Intruders Detected. All Units, Engage Intruders Immediately.

Name: Rouen
Phrase: W-What is that? What's with all the doors opening all at once, is the way opened...?

Name: Amiens
Phrase: Non, this is similar to how it feels when a trap is triggered.

Name: Putra
Phrase: No, no, no! This doesn't 'feel like' a trap, this is a trap! Didn't it just say 'invalid code recognized'!?

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Ugh, that's a nasty one for an archaeological site trap...

Name: Queensway
Phrase: Phantom Mist outbreak! Mist Monsters are coming out of the open door!

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: This passage is quite narrow. Watch out for pincers and protect Conductor.

Name: Rouen
Phrase: Amiens, let's do this together!

Name: Amiens
Phrase: Of course we do! I somehow had a feeling that this was going to happen!

Name: Rouen
Phrase: What the hell!? You mean you don't trust my deciphering!?

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: Enough bickering, both of you! I hope you two's combat skills are improving!?

Name: Amiens
Phrase: Leave it to me! No matter what happens, we will fight to the end for you!

Name: Rouen
Phrase: We'll show you the tricks we've honed in touring these ruins!
